Constructor Detail

Game

public Game()
Creates a "empty" game object. Please note that it is not possible to start the game if you don't have defined an world or no players logged in.

See Also:
start()

Game

public Game(World world,
            java.util.Vector<Player> players)
     throws NoPlayerLoggedInException,
            NotEnoughPlayersLoggedInException,
            WorldNotDefinedException,
            GameAlreadyStartedException,
            NoPlayerSlotAvailableException
Creates a new game, which already has all necessary data for starting the game.

Parameters:
world - The world to play on.
players - The players.
Throws:
NoPlayerLoggedInException
NotEnoughPlayersLoggedInException
WorldNotDefinedException
NoPlayerSlotAvailableException - If the given player vector is bigger than the available player slots.
GameAlreadyStartedException
Method Detail

start

public void start()
           throws NotEnoughPlayersLoggedInException,
                  NoPlayerLoggedInException,
                  WorldNotDefinedException
Starts the initialization process (generate player countries, allocate missions and so on). And ... starts the first turn.

Throws:
NotEnoughPlayersLoggedInException
NoPlayerLoggedInException
WorldNotDefinedException

nextTurn

public Turn nextTurn()
Sets the next player and creates a new Turn. A turn provides the core game logic.

Returns:
Turn

getPlayerCount

public int getPlayerCount()
Wrapper method for returning the player count.

Returns:
A count, that represents the players assigned to this game.

addPlayer

public void addPlayer(Player player)
               throws GameAlreadyStartedException,
                      NoPlayerSlotAvailableException
Add a new player to a game that is not running.

Parameters:
player - The player to add.
Throws:
GameAlreadyStartedException - Not able to add a new player to a already running game session.
NoPlayerSlotAvailableException - The game is full.

private void allocateCountries()
Allocates the countries. Every player gets an country in a randomized kind of way.

Gets a randomized color from the "available colors vector".

The determined color.

isPlayerColorAvailable

private boolean isPlayerColorAvailable()
Are there any player colors available? If not, the game is full and it is not possible add a new player.

Returns:
boolean
